title: Linkerd - Debugging Node Services in Kubernetes
description:
Node is one of the most popular languages for microservices. Increasingly, those services are deployed in a Kubernetes cluster. While Kubernetes can automatically keep your service up in the event of node failure or a software crash, it doesn’t actually know whether your service is behavior correctly.. In fact, a service may be returning 500’s or taking too long to respond and the Kubernetes  dashboard will show all green lights with no signs of problems!
n this tutorial, we’ll walk you through how to monitor and troubleshoots these sorts of problems on your Node services running in Kubernetes cluster in a matter seconds using Linkerd.
